to execute a particular target. Then I get a dialog box with "An error occurred 
please see log for more details".

with Eclipse 2.1 - ant 1.5.2 I get different behaviour

I can build successfully with both versions of ant from the command line. I 
have also successfully set up the ant build as an external tool in eclipse and 
it runs fine. Finally this all worked fine with Eclipse 2.01 and the old 
antview plugin.

I am currently running with JDK 1.4.1_04, although the project uses JDK1.3.1. I 
have also tried running Eclipse withg JDK 1.3.1 and have the same problems.

The "java.lang.VerifyError" looks like a duplicate of bug 34151 - please see 
the bug report for a description of the problem and a workaround. The NPE looks 
like a different problem that needs investigation.

Can you run the Ant build from the pop-up menu? i.e. select the file in the 
navigator and use "Run Ant..."?

The NPE looks like a duplicate of bug 38023, which has been fixed in the 3.0 
development stream.

e-mail from Lawrence:

"Yes I can run Ant build from pop up and it works fine. I have tried the 
workaround from bug 34151 and it doesn't work. In addition I tried using 
the default setting for eclipse and that doesn't work either. I get the 
same exception in both cases."
Do you have a version Xerces on your Java classpath for starting Eclipse?

I see the same NPE stack trace when I use a build.xml linked to a file in 
another directory.  Are you using the "linked" file feature?  If not, I'll 
file this as a separate bug report.

(I also have a patch that works in my environment, if you're interested.)

From Lawrence Marsh:

[...] I am not sure what you mean by a 'linked' file. I have an 'ant' folder 
under the main project folder in eclipse that is then linked to the real 
directory on the file system that contains build.xml. If this is what you mean 
then yes I would definitely be interested in your patch.  [...]

Response from Geoff Hardy:

From the looking at the code linked folders and linked files may exhibit the 
same behavior.  I'll attach the source patch in both context diff and unified 
diff formats.  (I also sent Lawrence my patched externaltools.jar.)

Created an attachment (id=5302)
Unified diff format patch file for externaltools plugin

Created an attachment (id=5303)
Context diff format patch file for externaltools

(Same as attachment 5302.)  Fixed AntUtil to call
IWorkSpaceRoot.findFilesForLocation() if getFileForLocation returns null.  It
then returns the first element of the array.  Not sure if this is the cleanest
way to fix it, but it works in simple test cases with linked build.xml.  Also
added check for null in RunTargetAction and AntView, and error pop-up.

(From update of attachment 5302)
(Same as attachment 5302, but in unified diff format.)	Fixed AntUtil to call
IWorkSpaceRoot.findFilesForLocation() if getFileForLocation returns null.  It
then returns the first element of the array.  Not sure if this is the cleanest
way to fix it, but it works in simple test cases with linked build.xml.  Also
added check for null in RunTargetAction and AntView, and error pop-up.

My attachments are there, but the comments aren't being displayed so I'll 
describe them again:

attachment 5302 (unified diff) and 5303 (context diff):  Changed AntUtil to 
call findFilesForLocation() on IWorkSpaceRoot if getFileForLocation returns 
null.  It then returns the first element of the array of IFile objects.  Since 
the code doesn't appear to use the IFile object for other than getting the 
actual file system path, it shouldn't matter which element of the array is 
used, but there may be a cleaner solution to this.  Also added check for null 
in RunTargetAction and AntView, and error pop-up.  I tested the patch in the 
simple test case with build.xml linked to a file in another directory.

The workspace is providing much better support for linked resources and we have 
reworked some of the AntUtil class.
Testing various combinations of linked folders and files I can no longer 
reproduce the problem so I do not believe any further changes are required 
(thanks though Geoff!).

Marking fixed.
